reviews.review_msg: Fantastic prof! Wish I could take more courses with him.

A fantastic prof. The course covered a lot of material, but he explained everything well and was engaging! The exams were pretty fair and based on the slides and learning objectives. He is quite helpful outside of class. I am looking forward to take another class with him.
One of my favorite profs at SFU. He keeps classes interesting and genuinely wants us to do well. Midterms were fair. I would definitely take more classes with him.
Steer clear. Super tough and hard to discuss anything with. Not lenient at all lol

Smart guy but his grading's a little too harsh. If u HAVE to take this course, take my advice: skim the textbook for worksheet answers. Don't let the worksheets teach u the course bc hes just going to recap everything in a 3 hr lecture. Be good w writing exam answers bc he has simple q's that r worth 8+ points and hes looking for specific wording.

Participation is 10% of grade. If you miss one class OR one assignment (11 of each), he deducts MORE than 1/10%. You could miss 2 classes and do all 11 worksheets, and still get 7/10 for participation with no explanation. Exam questions are tricky, and makes it his mission to make students unprepared. Lectures are less than unhelpful and very dry

WORST PROF EVER!!! Hard to understand, hard quiz/exam, doesnt want students to succeed! I read reviews and gave him a chance ... BUT DONT MAKE SAME MISTAKE! Material is interesting but prof no do good job in teaching. No set grading criteria, assigns marks as wish with intention to fail students. Tests on material barely covered in class. AVOID!!!

3 hour lectures that talk about the stuff he already assigned for us to self teach the week before. Midterms and final make up 90% of grade. Said in class that worksheets counted as our participation but took off an entire week of participation marks for not attending class even if you did the worksheet. Asks unreasonable questions on the final

Course is 100% self taught. Assigned readings and worksheets on material not yet mentioned every week that are quite extensive (3-7 pages), then you come in to a 3 hour lecture that just recaps what you spent the entire past week trying to teach yourself. Slides arent very helpful, doesnt really answer questions when you ask. Cumm. final worth 50%

He is a nice guy but I would NOT take him again. He is VERY hard to understand and this whole course was self taught. Only 3 exams that are short but his questions are very hard to understand and he has VERY specific wording he is looking for so if you don't use the key word you get 0. 1 word answer questions are worth 9+ points just awful.

Lectures uninformative, broken english on slides and while giving lectures. three 30 min quizzes are worth 15% each. quiz questions foreshadowed in review part of each lecture, too bad you cant find answer though. going to 3 hour lectures per week dont help. pretty much self taught in this course. amazed i even passed.

Very, very difficult to understand during lectures. Some exam questions cover content not touched in lecture (you would need to memorize the entire text to get all of these). We just got back a midterm where the average grade was 10/30! He was laughing at us under his breathe when telling us how badly the class had done. Terrible.
